data.title: Typo line 164 in vscode.d.ts
data.body: `[0, lineCount) -> [0, lineCount]`

data.title: "Open with Code" contextual menu button not working with `.tex` files
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.4.0
- OS Version: Windows 10 build 14393.447

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Download a `.tex` (LaTeX file).
2. Browse to the file location in File Explorer.
3. Right click the file.
4. Click the "Open with Code" button.
5. A dialogue pops up: "How do you want to open this .tex file?" Visual Studio Code is not an option on the list.

Desired behavior: clicking this button should open the `.tex` file in Visual Studio Code.

data.title: RSS Feed for extensions gallery
data.body:
It would be great to have a RSS feed for the new extensions added to the gallery. 
It might not be related to this repo but I couldn't find a repo for the extension gallery website.

data.title: Extension Preview - Don't show drop down with a single option only
data.body:
When the workspace is not opened on a folder, then the extension preview should only have a button 'disable' and not a drop down 'disable' with an option 'always'

data.title: Add an explorer button in "Zen Mode"
data.body:
Minimal interface is terrific, but having to hop in and out to open a file (or having to type the file name) is awkward. 

A button that presents a floating explorer pane would be much more convenient.

data.title: Incorrect TextMate syntax highlighting for meta category
data.body:
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1827708/20860834/6613dda4-b98a-11e6-8dfa-3914f8df4b68.png)

The names for the parentheses on the first line in the TextMate grammar file are defined as: `meta.keyword.bug.parantheses.[...]` and on the second line broken's metabug's name is defined as `meta.keyword.bug.parameter.metabug`.

On all themes included with Visual Studio Code by default don't specify anything about `meta.keyword[...]`, so it shouldn't be highlighted. (Dark+ theme is being used on the screenshot)

- VSCode Version: 1.7.2
- OS Version: Ubuntu 16.10

Steps to reproduce:
1. Clone [this reproduction sample](https://github.com/tambry/vscode_meta_bug).
2. Open the cloned folder in Visual Studio Code.
3. Press F5 to run the extension in a new instance.
4. Open the `test.metabug` file that's included in the sample's root folder in the new instance running the example syntax support extension.
5. Witness improper syntax highlighting.

data.title: Settings: view state lost when switching tabs
data.body:
Fixes https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/16434

@sandy081 I noticed a couple of issues in side by side editor:
* `position` was not forwarded to editors in `setEditorVisible` and `changePosition`
* `setVisible` was called only after `setInput` was called
* `clearInput` was not forwarded to the embedded editors

All of these issues basically meant that the file editor for `settings.json` was unable to store and restore its view state.

data.title: Settings: view state lost when switching tabs
data.body:
Steps to Reproduce:

1. open settings 
2. select something in settings.json on the right hand side
3. click on another tab
4. go back
=> view state is lost

data.title: DND: visible watermark prevents dropping of files (fixes #15698)
data.body:
@chrmarti this change puts the watermark into the content element of the editor part and hides it when drop feedback is indicated.

I also removed the `has-watermark` class because we no longer seem to use it and this change makes a reload with empty editor area smoother because the VS logo is not moving up after the workbench has been loaded.

data.title: GDB stepping isn't working right on Ubuntu
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.7.2
- OS Version: Ubuntu 16.04

**Steps to Reproduce:**
1. install C++ extension from Microsoft and the Native Debug extension by "webfreak".
2.  setup remote debugging via GDB server of a C++ app compilied by g++ with -ggdb. 
3.  create launch.json file with "type":"gdb", "request":"attach", "remote":"true", with target set to the port that GDB server is listening on.
4. set a breakpoint that you will hit
5. hit the break point and press F10 or click "step over" button on the debug toolbar.

**Expected**: move to next line of code.

**Actual**: every step operation reports and error:
"Source ../sysdeps/unix/sysv/linux/x86_64/cancellation.S is not available."

Clicking step one more time works, but this intermediate error on every step makes debugging rather painful.  I also found step out sometimes doesn't work.

data.title: html language server breaks js auto completion if imports are used
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Latest insider `1.8` commit `daa71...`
- OS Version: `Windows 10`

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Use import statement inside an html file.
2. Try auto completion from any built in library. For example: 
`console.log('Hello World!')`

What is actually happening:
- JavaScript auto completion stops working with the following error from html language server:
```
[Error - 7:11:19 AM] Request textDocument/completion failed.
  Message: Request textDocument/completion failed with message: Cannot read property 'length' of undefined
  Code: -32603
```
What is expected:
- Import statements are not supported (yet?) in html-language-server . So, it should be ignored.

data.title: Improve discoverability of Right Arrow action in Quick Open
data.body:
- VSCode Version: `Version 1.8.0-insider (1.8.0-insider)` daa71ca002722c2778dc30bba151d7316e3c5e54
- OS Version: `macOS Sierra 10.12.1 (16B2555)`

I would be great if from the Quick Open widget you could search for a set of files (package.json, project.json, etc) and either multiselect inside the quick open to open them all at once. Or be able to click on each file individually with a modifier pressed (shift?, alt?) which would open the file (not in preview) and keep the Quick Open widget open so it could be repeated.

I find myself wanting this feature VERY often when dealing with file sets like package.json or project,json, etc, but also with any file pairs -- like code behind, controller/view, etc.

data.title: Fix null exception on runSelectedText Terminal Action for Webview
data.body:
Fixes #16421

Adds a nullcheck before attempting to grab text from the active editor.

data.title: workbench.action.terminal.runSelectedText Action Null Exception When Used in WebViews
data.body:
Steps to Reproduce:

1. Create a custom keybinding for `workbench.action.terminal.runSelectedText'` without a `when` clause
2.  Open a webview (html/markdown preview) and select some text.
3. Run keybinding

Null exception since there is no valid editor.

data.title: OutputEvent objects should respect output severity
data.body: If category is stderr, then 'variables' is never called.

data.title: Fix spelling mistake "Occurrences" has two r's.
Reason for ctrl+q binding to workbench.action.quickOpenView

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body: We just bound ctrl+q to quit the application on Linux, I think it would make sense to bring that to Windows too. Also being very similar to how ctrl+tab works, I find ctrl+q to open the quickOpenView feels a bit weird when ctrl+shift+q opens the debug console. Holding ctrl+q and using arrows feels strange to me.

data.title: Debug console is not updated when collapsed
data.body:
- Start debugging
- Hide the debug console
- Have the debug session write some text into it
- Show the debug console

The new text won't be visible. But if something else is written, then all the new text will appear. I'll press enter in the console to force text to appear sometimes. 

It reproes consistently for me, but let me know if you can't repro it.

data.title: Test: Text search
data.body:
Complexity: 3

- [x] Windows @alexandrudima 
- [x] OS X @mjbvz 
- [x] Linux @Tyriar 

Main issue: #15384

Text search now runs in multiple processes. Please verify that...
- There are no missing or duplicated results
- It does not look slower than before
- All the bells and whistles on the search viewlet work as before. Regex search, search/replace, etc.
- Since the search workers time out after one minute and will be restarted for the next search, test that
  - You can do a search, wait a full minute, then do another search
  - You can do two searches back to back
- Search can be canceled using esc

data.title: Blacklist typescript.useCodeSnippetsOnMethodSuggest in certain contexts
data.body:
fixes #2092

**bug**
With `typescript.useCodeSnippetsOnMethodSuggest` enabled, we will automatically complete function calls inside some contexts where they should not be completed. For example, destructing assigments.

**fix**
Add a quickinfo check on the position before attempting to insert a function call. Create a blacklist of invalid contexts. Otherwise, assume that we want to complete the function call.


![dec-02-2016 16-08-00](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/12821956/20854517/8c3c7ac2-b8a9-11e6-84ff-23f641d50fd3.gif)
